Author: iamjack.sol

Yep - it was determined that this endpoint doesnt conform to the spec and an issue was filed:
https://github.com/Shard-Labs/starknet-devnet/issues/382

Author: 0x1379
Content: How to make `cairo-test` work with project initialized with nile-rs? @martriay

Author: martriay
Content: @ericnordelo is the `nile-rs` guy

Author: ericnordelo
Content: Hi @0x1379 | @ZKX . Currently there is no a test integration on nile, so you need to use the compiler crates directly. Assuming you are using this already, and you are facing an issue at compilation time, this is probably because the test-runner crate from the compiler doesn't (currently) use scarb modules resolution, and if you are using external contracts leveraging scarb (nile compile does this), the test-runner is not able to compile those, because it can't find the external artifacts. If you are not using external modules you should be fine though. We plan to integrate the test-runner on nile through a test command, and then we will work on this, but keep in mind that is a compatibility issue between scarb compilation and test-runner compilation mechanisms.

Author: 0x1379
Content: Thanks for the reply.

Author: udayj.
Content: @ericnordelo when could we expect nile-rs to work with the latest version of the cairo 1.0 compiler v1.0.0-rc0 or v1.1.0-rc0

Author: zkperma
ericnordelo
Content: Hey guys, sorry for the late reply (I should be more active on discord). Nile development is currently on hold, because we are prioritizing the Cairo 1 libraries (and there are other tooling available focused on solving what Nile targets). I suggest to use one of these tools instead, and if there is enough requests or some contributors are willing to keep Nile up to date while our focus is on a different direction, we may continue supporting it in the future. Sorry for the inconveniences.
